Crime_Name: Deportation and Cruel and Unusual Treatment
Legal_Issue: Is deportation to Croatia cruel and unusual treatment under Section 12 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms?
Governing_Law: Section 12 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Legal_Rule: Section 12 of the Charter prohibits cruel and unusual treatment
Grounds_for_Claim: Potential cruel and unusual treatment upon deportation to Croatia
Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided; application dismissed as premature
Key_Evidence_Considered: Dynamic political situation in Croatia, possibility of relief or delay by Minister
Legal_Framework: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Applicant_Challenge: Removal order based on risk of cruel and unusual treatment
Court_Result: Application dismissed, no certification to Court of Appeal
Remedy_Requested: Certification of question to Court of Appeal
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 12 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Risk of cruel and unusual treatment upon deportation
Applicable_Process: Removal order execution, potential ministerial relief
Governing_Rule: Section 12 of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
